intro: Browningia albiceps, commonly known as the white-headed browningia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which are typically white or pale pink, bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Browningia albiceps is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
